name: hardwood forestry, eucalyptus ssp., sustainable forest management | sawlog and veneer log, eucalyptus ssp., measured as solid wood under bark | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1641/documentation

This dataset represents the plantation establishment, management and harvesting of one m3 eucalyptus wood. ;The dataset is assumed to cover (close to) sustainable plantation management in Thailand. The dataset represents a short-rotation plantation of eucalyptus ssp. for pulp and paper production. ;Due to lack of data from Thailand complimentary data has been used; raw material use and air emissions are assumed similar to logging in Denmark, Dutch data on forestry processes are used. ;Branchings are assumed to be burned on site and non-site-specific literature values for the amount of branchings and emissions from biomass burning is used. ;Wood density and land use can vary considerably within a species and depending on how intensive the forest is used. Since the data used are valid for one specific company and region the uncertainty is rather high.;This dataset represents the natural growth of one m3 eucalyptus trees in forest plantation. ;The dataset is assumed to represent the production of the most widely used eucalypgus species, E. camaldulensis, in Thailand by (close to) sustainable forest management (SFM). Data refers to wood 'under bark'. The CO2-assimilation of the biomass is calculated from a carbon content of 49.4% including bark (10%). The energy content embodied in the biomass equals its gross calorific value including bark. ;The solar energy uptake is calculated as the upper heating value (26.81 MJ/kg at u=50% ) based on a lower heating value  of 18.83 MJ/kg. The assumed wood density is 825 kg/m3 (u=0%).;;Wood density and land use data can vary considerably within a species and depending on how intensive the forest is used. Since the data used are valid for one specific company and region the uncertainty is rather high. ;Complementary European literature values were used when site-specific data was unavailable. The representativeness of the dataset is considered low because European data was used for almost all relevant processes due to a lack of data from Thailand.

Plantation establishment process starting from eucalyptus tree planting.  Natural growth process starting from standing eucalyptus trees at plantation.

This activity ends with harvested eucalyptus tree logs, at forest road. The dataset includes plantation establishment, management, harvesting, hauling operations and biomass burning of branchings. The dataset does not include branchings left to rot on the ground, fuel consumption and the use of gravel and land for forest roads.  This activity ends with standing eucalyptus trees before harvesting. The dataset includes the CO2 absorption from air and the land use for the trees to grow (including 10% bark). The dataset does not include the land use of forest road area.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: source assumes Dutch process data, due to the lack of specific data
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technological  representativity of this dataset for forestry conditions in Thailand is considered to be low. ;During plantation and growing some fertilizers are used; however, applied quantities are unknown. Trees are harvested mechanically around year 3 at a dbh of 20 centimeters and an average height of 3 meters; 17.5% of tree is loss from delimbing. The production of 228.75 kilograms of log or 3.6 trees needs land of 4.16 m2 per year.;The production practise equals natural growth in sustainable forestry. Natural growth relates to the forest area and CO2 from the atmosphere needed to produce eucalyptus trees.

exchanges.description: Reference product. Eucalyptus timber output from the plantation establishment, management and harvesting via (close to) sustainable plantation management in Thailand. The plantation is a short-rotation plantation of eucalyptus ssp. for pulp and paper production.

flow.name: sawlog and veneer log, eucalyptus ssp., measured as solid wood under bark
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

exchanges.description: Estimation. Assumed rotation length = 20 years. Geographically not representable.
Calculated Value. Dried matter = 825 kg/m3, carbon content of dried matter = 49.4 %; including bark
Calculated Value. Resource correction for branchings.
